name: inunction

the act of rubbing an ointment (= a thick substance containing a medicine) on someone's skin: by inunction Administering drugs by inunction has been made safer with the introduction of a measured dose. Apply the ointment to the affected areas 2 to 3 times daily by gentle inunction.
More examplesFewer examplesHe argued that inunction was the preferable method because practitioners could exercise greater control over the dosage. He attempted to dissuade colleagues from using inunction because he considered it to be unreliable, imprecise, and dirty.
